text: Mithridates VI Eupator (135–63 BC) (Greek: Μιθραδάτης) was king of Pontus during the Mithridatic dynasty. The Hellenistic kingdom was based in ancient Anatolia. He is known as Mithridates the Great or Mithridates the Poison king. He reigned from 120 BC to 63 BC. == References == Category:History of Greece
title: Mithridates VI Eupator
